meanings.sent1: The rebels planned to overthrow the oppressive ruler.
meanings.sent2: The army managed to overthrow the corrupt government.
meanings.sent3: The citizens cheered as they watched the overthrow of the unjust leader.
meanings.sent4: The sudden overthrow of the dictator surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The overthrow of the monarchy marked a new era for the country.

meanings.definition: Defeat or vanquish in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The underdog team aimed to overthrow the reigning champions.
meanings.sent2: The skilled boxer was able to overthrow his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The chess player's strategic moves led to the overthrow of the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected overthrow of the top seed player shocked the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The student's hard work paid off when he managed to overthrow the spelling bee champion.

meanings.definition: Cause the downfall or destruction of.
meanings.sent1: The economic crisis threatened to overthrow the small business.
meanings.sent2: The natural disaster could potentially overthrow the entire village.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally caused the overthrow of the carefully arranged vase.
meanings.sent4: The virus outbreak had the potential to overthrow the fragile healthcare system.
meanings.sent5: The reckless actions of the driver could easily overthrow the safety measures in place.
